title.native: 乱歩奇譚 Game of Laplace

description:
Inspired by the works of author Edogawa Ranpo: When several murders at a middle school attract the attention of genius detective, Akechi, a student named Kobayashi volunteers to help with his investigation.

(Source: FUNimation)

title.native: 乱歩奇譚 Game of Laplace

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

He is a white blood cell, specifically a T Lymphocyte (Memory T Cell) that works under the Killer T Division. He is tasked with storing information about any foreign entities and cells that have invaded the body before.

(Source: Cells at Work Wiki)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/106669804) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/amazarashiofficial) | [Website](http://www.amazarashi.com)

A mysterious band led by singer [Hiromu Akita](https://anilist.co/staff/159938).

[Conan Edogawa](https://anilist.co/character/1742) (Meitantei Conan) & [Ranpo Edogawa](https://anilist.co/character/89201) (Bungou Stray Dogs) are named after him
[Gorou Akechi](https://anilist.co/character/121782) (Persona 5) & [Kogorou Mouri](https://anilist.co/character/1746) (Meitantei Conan) are named after Kogorou Akechi, the recurring detective from a number of his stories

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.

Hikaru was formerly an in-house writer for the eroge company Liar-soft and now is a freelance novelist.

[Website](http://sakuraihikaru.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/h_sakura)
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

__[Website](https://www.sayuri-official.com/)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1wLdD1RVGp_rLH1NRJnD0A)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taltalasuka)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sayuri149cm/)__

Sanketsu Shoujo Sayuri (lit. "Suffocating girl Sayuri") was a Japanese singer, musician and songwriter, signed under Ariola Japan.
Sayuri labeled herself as a 2.5D-parallel singer/songwriter, meaning she expressed herself through the internet in the 2D world and through live performances in the 3D world. 
For her 2D appearance she created various characters, mainly used in her music videos. While they all bear the name of Sayuri, each character's name differentiates itself by a different mix of Hiragana and Katakana (さゆり, サユリ, サゆり).

Sayuri made her major debut with the single "[Mikazuki](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=65BAeDpwzGY)", which was used as the ending theme to the Fuji TV anime "[Ranpo Kitan: Game of Laplace](https://anilist.co/anime/21189/Ranpo-Kitan-Game-of-Laplace/)".  Her first full-length album “Mikazuki no Kokai”, released May 17, 2017, debuted at #1 on Oricon’s daily album chart.

Sayuri announced her marriage to the vocalist and composer Ama Arashi (from the music group Misekai) on March 18th, 2024.

On September 27, 2024, her husband posted [an announcement](https://x.com/taltalasuka/status/1839500307094450552) on her X/Twitter account that she had passed away on September 20, 2024 at the age of 28.
Takao Naoki is a Japanese singer and lyricist
